title: travelplanner: Can you help me design a week-long travel itinerary for a group of 5, departing from Washington and visiting 3 different cities in Indiana? The trip should last from March 23rd to March 29th, 2022, and our budget is set at $23,800. It's important to note that our accommodations need to be suitable for children under 10 years of age. (11d45790f549696b)

always_included_messages.content:
Based on the user's query, make the best travel plan for the user and save it. Do not ask follow-up questions.
Use your best judgement in finding alternatives if possible. Don't give up - ALWAYS save a plan with the `submit_day_plan` function for each day of the trip!

chat_history.content: Can you help me design a week-long travel itinerary for a group of 5, departing from Washington and visiting 3 different cities in Indiana? The trip should last from March 23rd to March 29th, 2022, and our budget is set at $23,800. It's important to note that our accommodations need to be suitable for children under 10 years of age.

Sure! Here is a potential itinerary for a week-long trip to Indiana:

# Day 1: Indianapolis
- 23rd March: Arrive in Indianapolis, Indiana's capital city. Recommended flights from Washington to Indianapolis are limited on this date; however, there is an option via Charlotte on American Airlines, departing at 08:15 and arriving at 13:05. This flight has a layover time of 1 hour and 14 minutes.
- Stay: Check into The Alexander, a highly-rated, family-friendly hotel located downtown.
- Afternoon: Head to the Indianapolis Motor Speedway for a thrilling experience at the home of the Indianapolis 500. You can book a family-friendly tour to explore the track, museum, and even take a lap in a race car!
- Evening: Visit the White River State Park, a vast urban park with plenty of green spaces. Enjoy a picnic dinner and let the kids run around and explore the park's trails and playgrounds.

# Day 2: Indianapolis
- Morning: Start the day at the Indianapolis Zoo, a great attraction for kids. Here, you can see a variety of animals, from polar bears to dolphins.
- Lunch: Try Weber Grill, a family-friendly restaurant known for its grilled dishes and lively atmosphere.
- Afternoon: Explore the Indianapolis Children's Museum, one of the largest in the country, offering interactive exhibits and educational activities.
- Dinner: Head to St. Elmo Steak House for a special dining experience. This historic restaurant is known for its delicious steaks and shrimp cocktail, but also offers a kid-friendly menu.

# Day 3: South Bend
- 25th March: Travel to South Bend, a charming city approximately 150 miles from Indianapolis. You can rent a minivan for the journey, which should take around 2 hours and 30 minutes.
- Morning: Arrive in South Bend and check into the Morris Inn, a highly-rated hotel on the University of Notre Dame campus, offering comfortable accommodation for families.
- Lunch: Visit South Bend Chocolate Company for a sweet treat. This local chocolate factory offers tours and has a café serving light meals and, of course, delicious chocolate creations.
- Afternoon: Take a campus tour of the University of Notre Dame, a beautiful and iconic institution. The tour will take you through the historic buildings and provide insights into the university's rich history.
- Evening: Enjoy a dinner at Fiddler's Hearth, a family-friendly restaurant serving Irish-inspired cuisine.

# Day 4: South Bend and Valparaiso
- Morning: After a hearty breakfast at the hotel, take a short drive to Potato Creek State Park. This natural area offers hiking trails, a lake, and opportunities for fishing and wildlife watching—a great outdoor experience for the family.
- Lunch: Try Tap House on Main in Valparaiso, a family-friendly restaurant offering a variety of American dishes and craft beers for adults.
- Afternoon: Explore downtown Valparaiso. Start at the Taltree Arboretum & Gardens, a beautiful natural retreat with themed gardens and art installations. Then, stroll through the charming downtown area, browsing the local shops and enjoying the small-town atmosphere.
- Evening: Return to South Bend for a special dinner at Cafe Navarre. This restaurant offers a fine dining experience with a kid-friendly twist, ensuring a memorable meal.

# Day 5: Fort Wayne
- 27th March: Travel to Fort Wayne, a vibrant city in northeastern Indiana. A rental car or a minivan will be convenient for this approximately 2-hour drive from South Bend.
- Morning: Upon arrival, visit the Fort Wayne Children's Zoo, consistently ranked among the best zoos in the US. This zoo is perfect for a family outing, with interactive exhibits and a variety of animal species.
- Lunch: Try the Famous Coney Island Wiener Stand, a local institution known for its hot dogs and old-school diner vibes.
- Afternoon: Check into your accommodation at the Hilton Fort Wayne at the Grand Wayne Convention Center, a family-friendly hotel in the heart of downtown. Then, explore the Downtown Fort Wayne Historic District, including a visit to the Embassy Theatre, a stunning historic venue that often hosts family-friendly shows.
- Evening: Enjoy a casual dinner at 800° Three Fires Bakery & Grill, which offers wood-fired pizzas, burgers, and a cozy atmosphere.

# Day 6: Fort Wayne and Evansville
- Morning: Depart Fort Wayne and make your way to Evansville, a city in southern Indiana, approximately 3 hours' drive away.
- Lunch: Grab a bite at Walton's International Comfort Food in Evansville, serving a unique blend of international dishes.
- Afternoon: Visit Mesker Park Zoo and Botanical Garden, another excellent zoo experience for the family. Explore the diverse animal exhibits and enjoy the beautiful botanical gardens.
- Late Afternoon: Check into Tropicana Evansville, a hotel with excellent family-friendly facilities, including a swimming pool.
- Evening: Head to Gangnam Korean Restaurant for an authentic Korean BBQ experience.

# Day 7: Evansville
- 29th March: Spend the morning enjoying the amenities at your hotel, especially if the weather is not ideal. Tropicana Evansville has a range of indoor activities suitable for kids.
- Lunch: Try The Dapper Pig, a local favourite serving American comfort food.
- Afternoon: Before heading to the airport, visit the Angel Mounds State Historic Site, an important archaeological site with a preserved Native American settlement. The site offers an educational and engaging experience for kids to learn about Indiana's history.
- Departure: There are several flight options from Evansville to Washington, including a direct flight on American Airlines departing at 16:20 and arriving in Washington at 17:50.

Please note that this itinerary provides a general outline and can be customized further based on your preferences. I have submitted the plan for each day of your trip as requested.

functions.name: delegate
functions.desc:
Ask a capable helper for help looking up a piece of information or performing an action.
Do not simply repeat what the user said as instructions.
You should use this to break up complex user queries into multiple simpler steps.
NOTE: Helpers cannot see previous parts of your conversation.

instructions.description: Detailed instructions on what your helper should do to help you.

functions.name: accommodation_search
functions.desc:
Discover accommodations in your desired city.
Example: accommodation_search("Rome") would present a list of hotel rooms in Rome.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking accommodation.

functions.name: attraction_search
functions.desc:
Find attractions in a city of your choice.
Example: attraction_search("London") would return attractions in London.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking attractions.

functions.name: city_search
functions.desc:
Find cities in a state of your choice.
Example: city_search("California") would return cities in California.

state.description: The name of the state where you're seeking cities.

functions.name: flight_search
functions.desc:
A flight information retrieval tool.
Example: flight_search("New York", "London", "2022-10-01") would fetch flights from New York to London on October 1, 2022.

departure_city.description: The city you'll be flying out from.

destination_city.description: The city you aim to reach.

date.description: The date of your travel in YYYY-MM-DD format.

functions.name: google_distance_matrix
functions.desc:
Estimate the distance, time and cost between two cities.
Example: google_distance_matrix("Paris", "Lyon", "self-driving") would provide driving distance, time and cost between Paris and Lyon.

origin.description: The departure city of your journey.

destination.description: The destination city of your journey.

functions.name: restaurant_search
functions.desc:
Explore dining options in a city of your choice.
Example: restaurant_search("Tokyo") would show a curated list of restaurants in Tokyo.

city.description: The name of the city where you're seeking restaurants.

functions.name: submit_day_plan
functions.desc:
Once you have collected information about the trip, call this function once for each day of the trip, starting on day 1.
If a field does not apply for a given day, use "-" to indicate this.
You MUST call this function to save the plan for each query.

current_city.description: The city for this day. If the plan is to travel between two cities, indicate it as "from A to B" (e.g. "from Ithaca to Charlotte").

transportation.description: e.g. "Flight Number: F3633413, from Ithaca to Charlotte, Departure Time: 05:38, Arrival Time: 07:46"

breakfast.description: The name of a restaurant in the city, e.g. "Nagaland's Kitchen, Charlotte"

attraction.description: Use a ";" to separate different attractions, with each attraction formatted as "Name, City". e.g. "The Charlotte Museum of History, Charlotte;"

accommodation.description: e.g. "Affordable Spacious Refurbished Room in Bushwick!, Charlotte"
